title: Springs - length of spring given acceleration

content.description: An ideal spring of length <math alttext="L" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math> is attached to a ceiling and hangs vertically. A block is attached to the bottom of the spring, pulled downward, and released. The length of the spring as the block oscillates varies between <math alttext="1.00 meter" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.00</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> and <math alttext="1.10 meters" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>. The maximum acceleration of the block is measured to be <math alttext="2.00 meters per second squared" overflow="scroll"> <mn>2.00</mn> <mspace width="0.2em"> </mspace> <msup> <mtext>m/s</mtext> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </math>.
content.question: Which of the following is most nearly the length <math alttext="L" overflow="scroll"> <mi>L</mi> </math> of the spring?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
